intro: Alcantara, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Alcantara is native to Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields.
